oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of a man getting a medal, a dog, an alligator, children, golfers, dolls, a family portrait, and a military officer. Nashville Banner, 1928 December 23.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Huber, William Russell; Coolidge, Calvin; Rockefeller, John D.; Harris, Mrs. Tabbie; Burnley, Mrs. P. F.; Burnley, W. C.; Burnley, Jewell; Grant. U. S., III
Nashville Banner
Awards; Dogs; Alligators; Children; Golf; Christmas decorations; Group portraits; Military personnel; Presidents
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of a man receiving a medal of honor from President Coolidge, a dog with an alligator, children at a mailbox, golfers, dolls, a family portrait spanning four generations in Hartsville, Tennessee, and a man tasked with planning President Hoover's inauguration. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: P. & A. Photo
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
